title: Was Gamal Abdel Nasser a Muslim? - Quora

response.answer_text: I am not a scholar and this question requires a level of knowledge which only a true Islamic scholar possesses. What I can say for sure, is that this subject in Islamic law is called ex-communication (takfir) and it is a very serious subject. Basically, because everybody who declares his or her Islam is a Muslim and to prove otherwise you need solid proof. Even when you have this proof it is only a scholar, judge or the leader of a country who deals with the affair of such people. I advise anybody who wants more details to read the old and newer scholars of Islam. Muslims mostly agree on scholars of the salaf-us-saleh and they have written extensively on the subject. As for newer scholars who may have pronounced an opinion on the subject, I can mention: Shaykh Muhammad Saeed Rslan (Egypt)Shaykh Khalid Uthman al-Misri (Egypt)Shaykh Saleh Fawzan ibn Fawzan (KSA)Shaykh Rabee Ibn Hadi-Umayr Al Madkhaly (KSA)Shaykh Luhaydan (KSA)Shaykh ‘Abdullāh al-BukhārīShaykh Ahmad An NajmeeShaykh Nasr Ud Din Al Albany (Syria, died 2000),Shaykh Muqbil Al Hadee (Yemen, died 2000),Shaykh Bin Baz (KSA, d. 1999)Shaykh Muhammad Saleh bin uthaymin (KSA, d. 1999)
Only Allah knows who is a muslim. No one is able to judge anyone . Salaam
